body:
### asm2d

`asm2d` is an assembler for the 68112D microprocessor. The 68112D is a clone of the 68HC11 microcontroller, with new instructions to generate 2D graphics on a VGA display.

The assembler turns the assembly code into an [MIF](http://quartushelp.altera.com/9.1/mergedProjects/reference/glossary/def_mif.htm) file that can be used to initialise internal memory (RAM or ROM) during compilation and/or simulation (on an FPGA).

### Installation

Using **pip**:

``` bash
pip install asm2d
```

#### For development

``` bash
python setup.py develop
```

### Running

``` bash
asm2d source.s2d
```

### Help

``` bash
asm2d --help
```

### Authors and Contributors

Eduardo LÃ³pez Biagi (@tapichu).

### More Information

* **Documentation**: https://github.com/tapichu/asm2d/tree/master/docs
* **Source**: https://github.com/tapichu/asm2d
* **Issues**: https://github.com/tapichu/asm2d/issues
* **VIM plugin**: http://tapichu.github.com/asm2d-vim/
* **License**: [BSD New](http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause)
